panels.visual: A tall panel showing the flock descending a dark spiral staircase toward the bog. The girls move in single file, their white clothing catching what little light remains. Kari leads Eskil by the hand, pulling him into the darkness. The sound of drums grows louder. Ancient stone walls press close. Cobwebs hang like silver curtains in the moonlight filtering from above.
panels.narration: The flock descends a dark spiral staircase. To the sound of shawm and fiddle. Meat holds Kari's hand. She laughs and pulls him along.

panels.visual: Sofie's expression shifts to panic as a young girl tells her about Leif - Eskil's brother who reads runes and casts stones. Leif had warned Eskil this would be the worst night of all lives. The corrosive warmth of the sukarek burns in Sofie's stomach.
panels.dialogue: Young girl: "I think his brother possesses some knowledge. He reads runes, casts stones, they say."

panels.visual: In a dim side passage, Saga brings her weighted club down on Leif's skull. He crumples to the ground, his rune stones scattering. Sofie holds a lantern, her face illuminated with grim purpose. This complication must be handled.
